title: Do you like it when a person uses a ton of emojis in text messages? - Quora

response.answer_text: honestly, nope. i do not. when i was at a young age ( like 8 - 9 ), which meant i had a free state of mind, i always loved & i mean, LOVED to use emoticons so much. i really don’t know, maybe it was how they looked like & it was just fun to look at & send at somebody, when it concludes to you spamming them with emojis. basically, my friends & i used to do that. send each other emojis at the time. but sometimes it could happen when we leave our conversations ; with an emoji / emojis in the end of our sentence / message. now, i’m not saying that emojis are bad & all. it’s just that it could be annoying at times if i’d keep receiving messages from somebody who sends me a lot of emojis ; including those people who spam another person with emojis for no reason, or they don’t even know the meaning of the emoji, like ; the sleeping emoji. people always have mistaken that emoji of a person frowned & a tear on the cheek or a falling tear ( &, i wasn’t one of those people ). but, no. the ‘ tear ’ is actually a sleeping bubble where you can also find in an animé whenever you can see them sleep.  ↑ this is an example ↑ but back to what i was saying. truly, no, i do not like it when somebody ever sends me messages full of emoticons / emojis right after, or kind of spamming me with them. i find it very immature of them to ever do so, even if they know they’re annoying. so, if you see this, just know, that there are other people who could be sensitive on what you send them. i get very annoyed very easily, so i don’t recommend you do it to others either, whether a prank or not, or to call it ‘ fun ’. thank y’all for your understanding. & cooperation.

No. Emojis are like hieroglyphics to me: they’re a language substitute that doesn’t convey as much to me as words. But then I am a word person. So there’s that. A wall of emojis looks like this to me:  And it doesn’t mean a lot. People who are more into visual images may have problems with words and do better understanding images : they do well with emoji recognition.

No. An excessive number is too cutesy and kind of a “newbie” move - “I see that I CAN use emojis, so I’ll use TONS of them!” It’s the kind of thing well-meaning but dorky friends and family do. It’s like using cologne for the first time - “Um, I’m not saying you used too much, Billy, but I could smell you from all the way down the hallway…”

Only if that person and I are teasing and having an emoji war for fun, then sure. But for day to day life, no thank you. I prefer words than little pictures that could represent a million things that I could easily misinterpret.
Nope. Unless its a heart I don’t have any idea what most emojis mean.
No. But I don’t mind a few of them.
